words.definition: Something creative that expresses ideas or feelings, like paintings or sculptures.
sentences: She loves to visit art museums.
Drawing is a form of art.
Art can tell a story without words.

words.definition: The way of life, customs, and beliefs of a particular group of people.
sentences: Learning about different cultures is interesting.
Food is an important part of a country's culture.
Our school celebrates many cultures.

words.definition: A picture made with paint.
sentences: The painting of the landscape was beautiful.
She hung a new painting on the wall.
Many famous paintings are very old.

words.definition: A piece of art made by shaping materials like stone, wood, or metal.
sentences: The park has a large metal sculpture.
He is learning to make sculptures from clay.
Ancient cultures created amazing sculptures.

words.definition: Sounds organized in a way that is pleasant or exciting to listen to.
sentences: I love listening to music while I study.
She plays beautiful music on the piano.
Music can express many emotions.

words.definition: To move your body to the rhythm of music.
sentences: They performed a traditional dance.
Learning to dance is fun.
The party had lots of good music for dancing.

words.definition: A building where plays or shows are performed.
sentences: We went to the theater to see a play.
The theater was full of excited people.
She dreams of acting in a theater.

words.definition: A story written to be performed by actors.
sentences: The students put on a school play.
Reading a play is different from seeing it performed.
Shakespeare wrote many famous plays.

words.definition: A person who performs in plays, movies, or television shows.
sentences: My favorite actor is in that new movie.
She wants to be an actor when she grows up.
The actor delivered a powerful performance.

words.definition: A female actor.
sentences: The actress won an award for her role.
She is a talented actress.
Many famous actresses started in theater.

words.definition: The person who tells the actors what to do and guides the making of a play or movie.
sentences: The director made sure every scene was perfect.
She is a well-known film director.
The director had a clear vision for the play.

words.definition: A series of moving images shown on a screen, usually with sound, that tells a story.
sentences: Let's go watch a movie tonight.
That was a really exciting movie.
Many people enjoy watching movies at home.

words.definition: Another word for a movie.
sentences: The film won several awards.
He studies film at college.
The film festival showcases new movies.

words.definition: A written or printed work consisting of pages bound together.
sentences: I love reading a good book.
She borrowed a book from the library.
This book teaches you about history.

words.definition: A person who writes books or stories.
sentences: My favorite author writes fantasy novels.
The author signed copies of her new book.
Being an author requires a lot of creativity.

words.definition: A type of literature that uses rhythm and often rhyme to express feelings and ideas.
sentences: She enjoys reading and writing poetry.
The poet read her new poetry aloud.
Poetry can be very moving.

words.definition: A person who writes poetry.
sentences: The poet recited her latest work.
Many famous poets lived long ago.
He is a talented young poet.

words.definition: A long written story about imaginary people and events.
sentences: She is reading a new mystery novel.
Writing a novel takes a lot of time.
Many classic novels are still popular today.

words.definition: An account of imaginary or real people and events told for entertainment.
sentences: Tell me a bedtime story.
The movie has a very interesting story.
She loves to write short stories.

words.definition: Written works, especially those considered of superior or lasting artistic merit.
sentences: He studies English literature at university.
Classic literature is often taught in schools.
Literature helps us understand different times.

words.definition: A building where old and interesting objects, especially works of art or historical items, are kept and shown to the public.
sentences: We visited the natural history museum.
The museum has many ancient artifacts.
Museums are great places to learn.

words.definition: A room or building for the display or sale of works of art.
sentences: The art gallery showcased local artists.
She bought a painting from the gallery.
Many new galleries are opening in the city.

words.definition: A public display of works of art or other items.
sentences: The museum is holding a new exhibition of modern art.
The exhibition will run for three months.
We saw an amazing photography exhibition.

words.definition: A musical performance given in public, typically by several performers or of several compositions.
sentences: We went to a rock concert last night.
The orchestra gave a beautiful concert.
Are you going to the concert this weekend?

words.definition: A long piece of music for a large orchestra, typically in four movements.
sentences: Beethoven's Fifth Symphony is very famous.
The orchestra performed a new symphony.
Listening to a symphony is a grand experience.

words.definition: A group of instrumentalists, especially one combining string, woodwind, brass, and percussion sections and playing classical music.
sentences: The orchestra played beautifully.
She plays violin in the school orchestra.
The conductor led the orchestra.

words.definition: A dramatic work in one or more acts, set to music for singers and instrumentalists.
sentences: We saw an opera at the grand theater.
Opera singers have very powerful voices.
The story of the opera was very sad.

words.definition: An artistic dance form performed to music using precise and highly formalized set steps and gestures.
sentences: The ballet dancers moved gracefully.
She has been studying ballet since she was five.
The Nutcracker is a famous ballet.

words.definition: The sequence of steps and movements in a dance or ice skating routine.
sentences: The choreography for the show was amazing.
She designed the choreography for the new dance piece.
Good choreography makes a dance exciting.

words.definition: A day or period of celebration, typically for religious reasons or to celebrate a particular artistic form.
sentences: The city hosts a music festival every summer.
We celebrated the cultural festival with dancing.
The film festival showcases movies from around the world.

words.definition: A belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time.
sentences: It's a family tradition to have a big dinner on Sundays.
Many cultures have unique traditions.
This tradition has been passed down for generations.

words.definition: A traditional and widely accepted way of behaving or doing something specific to a particular society, place, or time.
sentences: It's a custom to shake hands when you meet someone new.
Many countries have different customs.
This custom dates back hundreds of years.

words.definition: Something inherited from the past; traditions, achievements, etc., that are passed down from one generation to the next.
sentences: The old building is part of our national heritage.
We should preserve our cultural heritage.
Learning about your heritage is important.

words.definition: The traditional beliefs, customs, and stories of a community, passed through generations by word of mouth.
sentences: The book collects local folklore.
Many myths and legends are part of folklore.
Folklore often teaches lessons.

words.definition: A traditional story, especially one concerning the early history of a people or explaining a natural or social phenomenon, and typically involving supernatural beings or events.
sentences: The story of Hercules is a Greek myth.
Many cultures have creation myths.
It's a common myth that bats are blind.

words.definition: A traditional story sometimes popularly regarded as historical but unauthenticated.
sentences: The legend of King Arthur is very famous.
Local legends tell of a hidden treasure.
Is that a true story or just a legend?

words.definition: A religious or solemn ceremony consisting of a series of actions performed in a prescribed order.
sentences: The ancient ritual was performed at sunrise.
Many cultures have unique rituals.
The wedding ceremony is a beautiful ritual.

words.definition: A thing that represents or stands for something else, especially a material object representing something abstract.
sentences: A dove is a symbol of peace.
The flag is a national symbol.
The heart is a symbol of love.

words.definition: A person or thing regarded as a representative symbol of something.
sentences: Marilyn Monroe is a fashion icon.
The Eiffel Tower is an icon of Paris.
The famous painting is an art icon.

words.definition: A work of outstanding artistry, skill, or workmanship.
sentences: Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa is a masterpiece.
The novel is considered a literary masterpiece.
The chef created a culinary masterpiece.

words.definition: A category of artistic composition, as in music or literature, characterized by similarities in form, style, or subject matter.
sentences: My favorite music genre is pop.
What genre of movies do you like?
Science fiction is a popular book genre.

words.definition: A distinctive manner or way of doing something.
sentences: The artist has a unique painting style.
Her writing style is very engaging.
This building is built in a modern style.

words.definition: A skillful or efficient way of doing something.
sentences: He uses a special technique to mix colors.
Learning a new dance technique takes practice.
The chef showed us a new cooking technique.

words.definition: The material or form used by an artist, composer, or writer.
sentences: Watercolor is a painting medium.
Clay is a common medium for sculpture.
What medium did the artist use?

words.definition: The way in which parts of a work of art or music are put together.
sentences: The painting has a balanced composition.
The musician worked on the composition of the song.
Good composition makes a photo visually appealing.

words.definition: The combination of different musical notes played or sung at the same time, producing a pleasing sound.
sentences: The singers created beautiful harmony.
Harmony is important in music.
The colors in the painting were in perfect harmony.

words.definition: A strong, regular, repeated pattern of movement or sound.
sentences: The music had a catchy rhythm.
She moved to the rhythm of the drum.
Poetry often uses rhythm.

words.definition: A sequence of single notes that is musically satisfying.
sentences: The song has a simple, memorable melody.
He hummed the melody of his favorite tune.
The melody was very soothing.

words.definition: The speed at which a passage of music is or should be played.
sentences: The music started with a slow tempo.
The tempo of the dance increased.
The conductor set the tempo.

words.definition: The words of a song.
sentences: I love the lyrics of that song.
She wrote the lyrics for the new album.
The lyrics tell a powerful story.

words.definition: The part of a song that is repeated several times.
sentences: Everyone sang along to the chorus.
The chorus is the catchiest part of the song.
The chorus was very uplifting.

words.definition: A group of lines forming the basic recurring metrical unit in a poem or song.
sentences: The first verse of the song sets the scene.
He recited a verse from his favorite poem.
Each verse tells a different part of the story.

words.definition: The assembled spectators or listeners at a public event, such as a play, movie, concert, or meeting.
sentences: The audience applauded loudly.
The play received a standing ovation from the audience.
The speaker engaged the audience with questions.

words.definition: An act of presenting a play, concert, or other form of entertainment.
sentences: The band's performance was amazing.
She gave a wonderful dance performance.
The evening performance starts at 7 PM.

words.definition: A raised platform on which actors, entertainers, or speakers perform.
sentences: The actors walked onto the stage.
She felt nervous before going on stage.
The stage was set for the play.

words.definition: A set of clothes worn by an actor or by someone dressing up for a party.
sentences: The actress wore a beautiful historical costume.
Children love to wear costumes for Halloween.
The play had elaborate costumes.

words.definition: The painted backdrops and movable pieces used to create the setting for a play or opera.
sentences: The scenery for the play was very realistic.
The stage designers created beautiful scenery.
The scenery changed for each act.

words.definition: An object used by actors on stage or on screen.
sentences: The actor held a prop sword.
The stage crew prepared all the props.
The prop looked very real.

words.definition: The written text of a play, movie, or broadcast.
sentences: The actors memorized their lines from the script.
She is writing a new movie script.
The director made changes to the script.

words.definition: Conversation between two or more people in a book, play, or movie.
sentences: The dialogue in the play was very witty.
She wrote realistic dialogue for her characters.
The movie had too much dialogue and not enough action.

words.definition: A long speech by one actor in a play or movie.
sentences: The actor delivered a powerful monologue.
She practiced her monologue for hours.
The play ended with a dramatic monologue.

words.definition: An interview for a role or position as a singer, actor, dancer, or musician, consisting of a performance.
sentences: She went to an audition for the school play.
He prepared a song for his audition.
Many actors attended the audition.

words.definition: A practice or trial performance of a play, opera, or piece of music.
sentences: The band had a long rehearsal before the concert.
The actors attended daily rehearsals.
The final rehearsal went smoothly.

words.definition: An appearance by performers at the end of a play or concert to acknowledge the audience's applause.
sentences: The audience gave them a long curtain call.
The actors took their curtain call.
The curtain call was the highlight of the evening.

words.definition: Clapping by an audience as a sign of approval or appreciation.
sentences: The audience erupted in applause.
She bowed to the applause.
The applause was deafening.

words.definition: A sustained and enthusiastic show of appreciation from an audience, especially by means of applause and standing.
sentences: The band received a standing ovation.
It was a well-deserved ovation.
The audience gave a thunderous ovation.

words.definition: A detailed analysis and assessment of something, especially a literary or philosophical theory.
sentences: The art critic wrote a critique of the exhibition.
She asked for a critique of her essay.
A constructive critique helps you improve.

words.definition: A formal assessment or examination of something with the possibility or intention of instituting change if necessary.
sentences: The movie received positive reviews.
He wrote a review of the new restaurant.
The book review helped me decide to read it.

words.definition: A person who judges and evaluates works of art, literature, music, etc.
sentences: The music critic praised the new album.
He is a harsh critic of modern art.
The food critic gave the restaurant a good review.

words.definition: A public display of works of art or other items.
sentences: The museum is holding a new exhibition of modern art.
The exhibition will run for three months.
We saw an amazing photography exhibition.

words.definition: An art exhibit that consists of a collection of objects or materials arranged in a specific way in a gallery or other space.
sentences: The artist created a large-scale installation.
The light installation was mesmerizing.
Many modern art museums feature installations.

words.definition: A strong, coarse unbleached cloth made from hemp, flax, or a similar yarn, used to make sails and tents and as a surface for oil painting.
sentences: The artist painted on a large canvas.
She stretched the canvas before painting.
The painting covered the entire canvas.

words.definition: A mark made by a brush in painting.
sentences: You can see the artist's bold brushstrokes.
Each brushstroke added to the texture.
The painting was full of quick brushstrokes.

words.definition: A thin board or slab on which an artist lays and mixes colors.
sentences: The artist mixed colors on her palette.
The painting used a vibrant palette of colors.
He cleaned his palette after painting.

words.definition: A wooden frame for holding an artist's work while it is being painted or drawn.
sentences: The artist set up her easel outdoors.
He placed the canvas on the easel.
The easel held the painting steady.

words.definition: A rough drawing or painting, often made as a preliminary study.
sentences: She made a quick sketch of the landscape.
The artist keeps a sketchbook for her sketches.
His sketch captured the essence of the moment.

words.definition: A painting, drawing, sculpture, or photograph of a person or animal.
sentences: The artist painted a beautiful portrait of the queen.
She had her portrait taken.
Many famous portraits hang in museums.

words.definition: A picture representing a view of natural inland scenery.
sentences: The painting depicted a beautiful mountain landscape.
He specializes in painting landscapes.
The artist captured the peaceful landscape.

words.definition: A work of art depicting inanimate subjects, such as fruit, flowers, or household objects.
sentences: She painted a still life of fruit.
Still life paintings are common in art history.
The artist arranged the objects for her still life.

words.definition: Art that does not attempt to represent external reality, but rather achieves its effect using shapes, forms, colors, and textures.
sentences: Abstract art can be interpreted in many ways.
She enjoys looking at abstract art.
Many modern artists create abstract art.

words.definition: The quality or fact of representing a person, thing, or situation accurately or in a way that is true to life.
sentences: The painting showed great realism.
Realism in art aims for accuracy.
He is known for his realism in his sculptures.

words.definition: A 19th-century art movement characterized by relatively small, thin, yet visible brushstrokes, open composition, emphasis on accurate depiction of light in its changing qualities, ordinary subject matter, inclusion of movement as a crucial element of human perception and experience, and unusual visual angles.
sentences: Monet is a famous Impressionism painter.
Impressionism focuses on light and color.
Many Impressionism paintings are very beautiful.

words.definition: A 20th-century avant-garde movement in art and literature that sought to release the creative potential of the unconscious mind, for example by the irrational juxtaposition of images.
sentences: Salvador Dal√≠ is famous for his Surrealism art.
Surrealism often features dreamlike images.
The painting had a strong sense of Surrealism.

words.definition: The revival of art and literature under the influence of classical models in the 14th‚Äì16th centuries.
sentences: The Renaissance was a period of great artistic growth.
Many famous artists lived during the Renaissance.
The Renaissance brought new ideas to Europe.

words.definition: A highly ornate and extravagant style of architecture, art, and music that flourished in Europe from the early 17th to mid-18th century.
sentences: The church had elaborate Baroque decorations.
Baroque music is often grand and complex.
The Baroque period produced many famous artists.

words.definition: Relating to ancient Greek or Roman art, literature, or culture, or to a style that is traditional and formal.
sentences: She enjoys listening to classical music.
The building has a classical design.
Classical art often features balanced compositions.

words.definition: Artistic works produced during the period extending roughly from the 1860s to the 1970s, and denoting the style and philosophy of the art produced during that era.
sentences: The museum has a large collection of modern art.
Modern art often challenges traditional ideas.
Many people find modern art interesting.

words.definition: Art produced at the present period in time.
sentences: Contemporary art often reflects current society.
The gallery showcases contemporary art.
She is a collector of contemporary art.

words.definition: Art produced by indigenous people or peasants and other isolated cultural groups.
sentences: The market sold beautiful folk art.
Folk art often uses traditional techniques.
Many cultures have rich traditions of folk art.

words.definition: An activity involving skill in making things by hand.
sentences: She enjoys various crafts like knitting and pottery.
The market sold handmade crafts.
Learning a new craft can be very rewarding.

words.definition: Pots, dishes, and other articles made of fired clay.
sentences: She made a beautiful pottery vase.
The ancient civilization was known for its pottery.
Learning pottery is a relaxing hobby.

words.definition: A type of cloth or woven fabric.
sentences: The museum displayed ancient textiles.
Textile art uses threads and fabrics.
The region is famous for its colorful textiles.

words.definition: Personal ornaments, such as necklaces, rings, or bracelets, made from jewels or precious metal.
sentences: She wore beautiful silver jewelry.
The museum has a collection of ancient jewelry.
Making jewelry can be a creative hobby.

words.definition: The art or practice of designing and constructing buildings.
sentences: The city is known for its stunning architecture.
He studies architecture at university.
Ancient Roman architecture is still admired today.

words.definition: A statue, building, or other structure erected to commemorate a notable person or event.
sentences: The city has many historical monuments.
The monument honors fallen soldiers.
Visiting monuments helps us remember history.

words.definition: An object or feature of a landscape or town that is easily seen and recognized.
sentences: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark in Paris.
The old clock tower is a local landmark.
Many tourists visit famous landmarks.

words.definition: The principal church of a diocese, with which the bishop is officially associated.
sentences: The ancient cathedral is a beautiful example of Gothic architecture.
We visited the grand cathedral in the city center.
The cathedral's stained glass windows are stunning.

words.definition: A building devoted to the worship, or regarded as the dwelling place, of a god or gods or other objects of religious reverence.
sentences: The ancient temple was dedicated to a goddess.
Many cultures have beautiful temples.
We visited a Buddhist temple in Thailand.

words.definition: A Muslim place of worship.
sentences: The beautiful mosque has a tall minaret.
Many people gather at the mosque for prayer.
The mosque's architecture was intricate.

words.definition: A building used for public Christian worship.
sentences: They go to church every Sunday.
The old church has beautiful stained glass.
Many towns have a church at their center.

words.definition: The building where a Jewish assembly or congregation meets for religious worship and instruction.
sentences: The synagogue is a place of worship for Jewish people.
They celebrated a holiday at the synagogue.
The synagogue has a rich history.

words.definition: A tiered tower with multiple eaves, built in traditions originating as stupa in historic South Asia and further developed in East Asia with Buddhist influence.
sentences: The ancient pagoda stood tall on the hill.
Many beautiful pagodas are found in Asia.
The pagoda is a sacred place.

words.definition: A place regarded as holy because of its association with a divinity or a sacred person or relic, marked by a building or other construction.
sentences: Visitors left offerings at the shrine.
The small shrine was hidden in the forest.
Many people visit the shrine to pray.

words.definition: A style of architecture prevalent in western Europe in the 12th‚Äì16th centuries, characterized by pointed arches, rib vaults, and flying buttresses, together with large windows and elaborate tracery.
sentences: Notre Dame Cathedral is a famous example of Gothic architecture.
Gothic cathedrals are known for their height and light.
She loves the dark and mysterious feel of Gothic novels.

words.definition: A style of architecture developed in Europe in the 11th and 12th centuries, characterized by round arches, thick walls, and large towers.
sentences: The old church was built in Romanesque style.
Romanesque buildings often feel very solid.
He studied Romanesque art history.

words.definition: Relating to a style of art, architecture, or music that revives classical forms and principles.
sentences: Many government buildings are designed in a Neoclassical style.
Neoclassical art often emphasizes order and balance.
The museum has a collection of Neoclassical sculptures.

words.definition: A highly ornate and extravagant style of architecture, art, and music that flourished in Europe from the early 17th to mid-18th century.
sentences: The church had elaborate Baroque decorations.
Baroque music is often grand and complex.
The Baroque period produced many famous artists.

words.definition: An elaborately ornamental late baroque style of decoration prevalent in 18th-century Continental Europe, with asymmetrical patterns involving motifs and scrollwork.
sentences: Rococo art is known for its lightness and elegance.
The palace interior was decorated in Rococo style.
Rococo often features pastel colors.

words.definition: A style of art, architecture, and applied art, especially decorative arts, that was most popular during 1890‚Äì1910. It was inspired by natural forms and structures, not only in flowers and plants but also in curved lines.
sentences: Art Nouveau is characterized by flowing, organic lines.
Many old metro stations in Paris feature Art Nouveau design.
She collects Art Nouveau jewelry.

words.definition: The predominant decorative art style of the 1920s and 1930s, characterized by precise and boldly delineated geometric shapes and strong colors and often with lavish ornamentation.
sentences: The Chrysler Building is a famous example of Art Deco architecture.
Art Deco designs are often sleek and geometric.
She loves the Art Deco style of furniture.

words.definition: The revival of art and literature under the influence of classical models in the 14th‚Äì16th centuries.
sentences: The Renaissance was a period of great artistic growth.
Many famous artists lived during the Renaissance.
The Renaissance brought new ideas to Europe.

words.definition: A European intellectual movement of the 17th and 18th centuries emphasizing reason and individualism rather than tradition.
sentences: The Enlightenment brought new ideas about government and human rights.
Many famous philosophers were part of the Enlightenment.
The Enlightenment influenced art and literature.

words.definition: A movement in the arts and literature that originated in the late 18th century, emphasizing inspiration, subjectivity, and the primacy of the individual.
sentences: Romanticism often features strong emotions and nature.
Many poets were influenced by Romanticism.
The painting is a classic example of Romanticism.

words.definition: A style of painting, music, or drama in which the artist or writer seeks to express emotional experience rather than impressions of the external world.
sentences: Expressionism uses bold colors and distorted forms.
The Scream by Edvard Munch is an Expressionism painting.
Expressionism often shows inner feelings.

words.definition: An early 20th-century avant-garde art movement that revolutionized European painting and sculpture. In Cubist artworks, objects are analyzed, broken up and reassembled in an abstracted form‚Äîinstead of depicting objects from one viewpoint, the artist depicts the subject from a multitude of viewpoints to represent the subject in a greater context.
sentences: Picasso was a pioneer of Cubism.
Cubism breaks objects into geometric shapes.
The painting used elements of Cubism.

words.definition: An art movement that emerged in the 1950s and flourished in the 1960s in America and Britain, drawing inspiration from sources in popular and commercial culture.
sentences: Andy Warhol is a famous Pop Art artist.
Pop Art often uses bright colors and everyday objects.
She loves the bold style of Pop Art.

words.definition: Art that is created in public spaces, typically unsanctioned artwork executed outside of the context of traditional art venues.
sentences: The city is known for its vibrant street art.
Banksy is a famous street art artist.
Street art often carries a message.

words.definition: Writing or drawings scribbled, scratched, or sprayed illicitly on a wall or other surface in a public place.
sentences: Some graffiti is considered art.
The wall was covered in colorful graffiti.
Graffiti can be a form of self-expression.

words.definition: A painting or other work of art executed directly on a wall.
sentences: The artist painted a large mural on the building.
The mural depicted scenes from local history.
Many cities have beautiful murals.

words.definition: An artist who makes sculptures.
sentences: The sculptor shaped the clay into a figure.
Michelangelo was a famous sculptor.
The sculptor unveiled his new work.

words.definition: Pottery or articles made from clay and hardened by heat.
sentences: She took a class in ceramics.
Ancient cultures produced beautiful ceramics.
The exhibition featured modern ceramics.

words.definition: The art of heating and shaping glass by blowing air into it through a tube.
sentences: Glassblowing requires great skill.
They watched a demonstration of glassblowing.
The artist created intricate pieces through glassblowing.

words.definition: The craft or action of forming fabric by interlacing threads.
sentences: She learned the art of weaving from her grandmother.
Traditional weaving patterns are very complex.
The workshop teaches various weaving techniques.

words.definition: The art of working designs in fabric with a needle and thread.
sentences: The dress had beautiful embroidery.
She enjoys doing embroidery as a hobby.
Embroidery adds detail to clothing.

words.definition: Decorative handwriting or handwritten lettering.
sentences: He practices calligraphy every day.
The invitation was written in elegant calligraphy.
Calligraphy is an ancient art form.

words.definition: The Japanese art of folding paper into decorative shapes and figures.
sentences: She made a beautiful crane using origami.
Origami can be very intricate.
He enjoys teaching children origami.

words.definition: The art or process of producing images by the action of radiant energy and especially light on a sensitive surface (such as film or a CCD chip).
sentences: He is passionate about photography.
The exhibition showcased stunning photography.
Photography allows us to capture moments.

words.definition: A person who takes photographs, especially as a job.
sentences: The photographer captured beautiful wedding pictures.
She hired a professional photographer.
The photographer won an award for his work.

words.definition: Art that is made using computer software or other electronic devices.
sentences: Many artists now create digital art.
Digital art allows for endless possibilities.
The exhibition featured interactive digital art.

words.definition: The art or skill of combining text and pictures in advertisements, magazines, or books.
sentences: She studies graphic design at college.
Good graphic design is important for advertising.
He works in graphic design for a marketing firm.

words.definition: A drawing or picture in a book, magazine, etc.
sentences: The book has beautiful illustrations.
She specializes in children's book illustration.
The illustration helped explain the concept.

words.definition: A humorous drawing or sequence of drawings, often with a caption, or a motion picture using animation.
sentences: My favorite cartoon is about talking animals.
He draws political cartoons for the newspaper.
Children love watching cartoons.

words.definition: The technique of photographing successive drawings or positions of puppets or models to create an illusion of movement when the movie is shown as a sequence.
sentences: The animation in the movie was incredible.
He studies animation at art school.
Animation brings characters to life.

words.definition: A sequential art form, often combining images and text, that tells a story.
sentences: He loves reading superhero comics.
Many popular movies are based on comics.
The comic book store has a huge collection.

words.definition: A style of Japanese comic books and graphic novels, typically aimed at adults as well as children.
sentences: She enjoys reading manga in her free time.
Manga often has a distinct art style.
Many popular anime shows are based on manga.

words.definition: A style of Japanese film and television animation, typically aimed at adults as well as children.
sentences: He watches a lot of anime.
Anime often has unique storytelling.
Many popular anime series are available online.

words.definition: A story originating in popular culture, typically passed on by word of mouth.
sentences: My grandmother told us a traditional folktale.
Folktales often teach moral lessons.
Many cultures share similar folktales.

words.definition: A short story, typically with animals as characters, conveying a moral.
sentences: The Tortoise and the Hare is a famous fable.
Fables often have a clear moral.
Aesop's Fables are well-known.

words.definition: A collection of myths, especially one belonging to a particular sacred or religious tradition.
sentences: Greek mythology is full of gods and heroes.
She studies ancient mythology.
Many stories come from mythology.

words.definition: A long poem, typically derived from ancient oral tradition, narrating the deeds and adventures of heroic or legendary figures or the history of a nation.
sentences: The Odyssey is an ancient Greek epic poem.
The movie was an epic tale of adventure.
Epics often feature grand journeys.

words.definition: A long story of heroic achievement, especially a medieval Icelandic or Norse one.
sentences: The Lord of the Rings is an epic saga.
The family saga spanned several generations.
Norse sagas tell tales of Vikings.

words.definition: A story, poem, or picture that can be interpreted to reveal a hidden meaning, typically a moral or political one.
sentences: Animal Farm is an allegory about political power.
The story functions as an allegory for human life.
Allegory uses symbols to convey meaning.

words.definition: A simple story used to illustrate a moral or spiritual lesson, as told by Jesus in the Gospels.
sentences: The story of the Good Samaritan is a well-known parable.
Parables often teach important lessons.
He explained the concept using a parable.

words.definition: A short, popular saying, usually of unknown and ancient origin, that expresses some general truth or useful thought.
sentences: An apple a day keeps the doctor away is a common proverb.
Many proverbs offer wisdom.
My grandmother often quoted proverbs.

words.definition: A group of words established by usage as having a meaning not deducible from those of the individual words (e.g., rain cats and dogs).
sentences: Learning idioms can be tricky in a new language.
Kick the bucket is an idiom for dying.
The English language has many interesting idioms.

words.definition: A figure of speech in which a word or phrase is applied to an object or action to which it is not literally applicable.
sentences: The phrase 'time is money' is a metaphor.
Poets often use metaphors.
The teacher explained the metaphor clearly.

words.definition: A figure of speech involving the comparison of one thing with another thing of a different kind, used to make a description more emphatic or vivid (e.g., as brave as a lion).
sentences: Her smile was as bright as the sun is a simile.
Similes use 'like' or 'as' to compare.
The writer used many similes in her description.

words.definition: The occurrence of the same letter or sound at the beginning of adjacent or closely connected words.
sentences: Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers is an example of alliteration.
Poets use alliteration for sound effects.
The sentence used clever alliteration.

words.definition: The formation of a word from a sound associated with what is named (e.g., cuckoo, sizzle).
sentences: The word 'buzz' is an example of onomatopoeia.
Onomatopoeia makes writing more vivid.
The comic book used a lot of onomatopoeia like 'boom' and 'pow'.

words.definition: Exaggerated statements or claims not meant to be taken literally.
sentences: I'm so hungry I could eat a horse is an example of hyperbole.
Hyperbole is used for emphasis.
The speaker used hyperbole to make his point.

words.definition: Visually descriptive or figurative language, especially in a literary work.
sentences: The poem uses vivid imagery to describe the forest.
The author's imagery made the scene come alive.
Sensory imagery appeals to our senses.

words.definition: The use of symbols to represent ideas or qualities.
sentences: The novel is rich in symbolism.
The artist used symbolism to convey her message.
Understanding the symbolism adds depth to the story.

words.definition: The subject of a talk, a piece of writing, a person's thoughts, or an exhibition; a topic.
sentences: The main theme of the book is friendship.
The artist explored themes of nature in her work.
What is the central theme of the movie?

words.definition: A distinctive feature or dominant idea in an artistic or literary composition.
sentences: The recurring motif of birds appeared throughout the painting.
The motif of betrayal is common in tragedies.
The designer used a floral motif on the fabric.

words.definition: A spoken or written account of connected events; a story.
sentences: The book has a compelling narrative.
She created a visual narrative through her photographs.
The film's narrative was complex.

words.definition: The leading character or one of the major characters in a drama, movie, novel, or other fictional text.
sentences: The protagonist faced many challenges.
The story follows the journey of its protagonist.
The audience rooted for the protagonist.

words.definition: A person who actively opposes or is hostile to someone or something; an adversary.
sentences: The antagonist tried to stop the hero.
The antagonist in the story was truly evil.
The conflict between the protagonist and antagonist drove the plot.

words.definition: The main events of a play, novel, movie, or similar work, devised and presented by the writer as an interrelated sequence.
sentences: The plot of the movie was very exciting.
The story has a simple plot.
The detective tried to unravel the plot.

words.definition: The place or type of surroundings where something is positioned or where an event takes place.
sentences: The story's setting is a small village in the mountains.
The play had a beautiful historical setting.
The setting of the novel was very atmospheric.

words.definition: A person in a novel, play, or movie.
sentences: My favorite character in the book is the wise old wizard.
The actor played a complex character.
Good stories have well-developed characters.

words.definition: The most intense, exciting, or important point of something; a culmination or apex.
sentences: The climax of the movie was very thrilling.
The story built up to an exciting climax.
The climax of the play left the audience speechless.

words.definition: The action of solving a problem, dispute, or contentious matter.
sentences: The story's resolution brought all the plot lines together.
The conflict reached a peaceful resolution.
The resolution of the mystery was unexpected.

words.definition: A warning or indication of a future event.
sentences: The author used foreshadowing to hint at what was coming.
The dark clouds were a foreshadowing of the storm.
Foreshadowing builds suspense in a story.

words.definition: A sudden and disturbing vivid memory of an event in the past, typically as a result of psychological trauma or a literary device.
sentences: The movie used flashbacks to tell the character's backstory.
He had a sudden flashback to his childhood.
Flashbacks can reveal important information.

words.definition: A state or feeling of excited or anxious uncertainty about what may happen.
sentences: The thriller movie was full of suspense.
The author built suspense throughout the novel.
The audience was on the edge of their seats with suspense.

words.definition: The expression of one's meaning by using language that normally signifies the opposite, typically for humorous or emphatic effect.
sentences: It's ironic that the fire station burned down.
The play used dramatic irony.
Her sarcastic comment was full of irony.

words.definition: The use of humor, irony, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize people's stupidity or vices, particularly in the context of contemporary politics and other topical issues.
sentences: The show uses satire to comment on society.
Political cartoons often use satire.
Satire can be very effective in making a point.

words.definition: An imitation of the style of a particular writer, artist, or genre with deliberate exaggeration for comic effect.
sentences: The movie was a parody of classic horror films.
He wrote a parody of a famous song.
Parodies are often very funny.

words.definition: A play, movie, or television program that is intended to make people laugh.
sentences: We watched a hilarious comedy last night.
She prefers watching comedies over dramas.
The stand-up comedian performed a great comedy set.

words.definition: A play for theater, radio, or television, or a serious play or film.
sentences: The movie was a powerful drama.
She loves watching historical dramas.
The play was full of intense drama.

words.definition: A play dealing with tragic events and having an unhappy ending, especially one concerning the downfall of the main character.
sentences: Shakespeare's Hamlet is a famous tragedy.
The story ended in tragedy.
Tragedy often explores human suffering.

words.definition: A play or movie in which the story is told through singing and dancing as well as dialogue.
sentences: We went to see a Broadway musical.
The musical had catchy songs and amazing dances.
She dreams of performing in a musical.

words.definition: A dramatic work in one or more acts, set to music for singers and instrumentalists.
sentences: We saw an opera at the grand theater.
Opera singers have very powerful voices.
The story of the opera was very sad.

words.definition: An artistic dance form performed to music using precise and highly formalized set steps and gestures.
sentences: The ballet dancers moved gracefully.
She has been studying ballet since she was five.
The Nutcracker is a famous ballet.

words.definition: The sequence of steps and movements in a dance or ice skating routine.
sentences: The choreography for the show was amazing.
She designed the choreography for the new dance piece.
Good choreography makes a dance exciting.

words.definition: A person who directs the performance of an orchestra or choir.
sentences: The conductor led the orchestra with precision.
The conductor raised his baton.
A good conductor can bring out the best in musicians.

words.definition: A person who writes music.
sentences: Beethoven was a famous composer.
She is a talented young composer.
The composer wrote a new symphony.

words.definition: A person who plays a musical instrument or sings, especially as a profession.
sentences: He is a skilled musician.
The band consists of five talented musicians.
Many musicians practice for hours every day.

words.definition: A singer.
sentences: The band's vocalist has an amazing voice.
She is a lead vocalist in a jazz band.
The vocalist performed a beautiful solo.

words.definition: A tool or implement, especially one used for delicate or scientific work, or a musical instrument.
sentences: He plays several musical instruments.
The piano is a popular instrument.
What instrument do you play?

words.definition: A category of artistic composition, as in music or literature, characterized by similarities in form, style, or subject matter.
sentences: My favorite music genre is pop.
What genre of movies do you like?
Science fiction is a popular book genre.

words.definition: A genre of popular music that originated in its modern form in the mid-1950s in the United States and the United Kingdom.
sentences: Pop music is very popular with young people.
Her new song is a catchy pop music hit.
Pop music often has simple melodies.

words.definition: A form of popular music that evolved from rock and roll and pop music during the 1960s.
sentences: He loves listening to classic rock music.
Rock music often features electric guitars.
The band played loud rock music.

words.definition: A type of music of black American origin characterized by improvisation, syncopation, and usually a regular, forceful rhythm, emerging at the beginning of the 20th century.
sentences: She enjoys listening to smooth jazz.
Jazz music is known for its improvisation.
New Orleans is famous for jazz.

words.definition: A genre of music developed by African Americans in the Southern United States.
sentences: Blues music often expresses sadness.
He plays the guitar with a bluesy feel.
The history of blues music is rich.

words.definition: Music written in the European tradition during a period lasting approximately from 1750 to 1830, characterized by an emphasis on form and proportion.
sentences: She enjoys listening to classical music.
Classical music is often played by orchestras.
Many famous composers wrote classical music.

words.definition: Music that originates in traditional popular culture or that is written in such a style.
sentences: Folk music often tells stories of everyday life.
She sings traditional folk music.
Many countries have their own unique folk music.

words.definition: A musical category encompassing music from different cultures around the world, often combining traditional and modern elements.
sentences: The festival featured a variety of world music.
World music often uses unique instruments.
She loves discovering new world music artists.

words.definition: A style of popular music of US black and Hispanic origin, featuring rhythmic and rhyming speech ('rapping') to musical accompaniment.
sentences: Hip hop originated in the Bronx.
He loves listening to old school hip hop.
Hip hop culture includes music, dance, and art.

words.definition: Music produced using electronic instruments or circuitry.
sentences: Electronic music is popular in clubs.
He creates his own electronic music.
Electronic music often uses synthesizers.

words.definition: A recording of the musical accompaniment to a movie or play.
sentences: The movie has an amazing soundtrack.
I bought the soundtrack to my favorite film.
The soundtrack perfectly captured the mood.

words.definition: A collection of musical recordings issued on a record, compact disc, or other medium.
sentences: The band released a new album last month.
Her favorite album is from the 1980s.
The album sold millions of copies.

words.definition: A recording of a song that is released separately from an album.
sentences: Her new single is topping the charts.
The band released a new single today.
The single became an instant hit.

words.definition: A building designed for the performance of concerts.
sentences: The orchestra performed at the new concert hall.
The concert hall has excellent acoustics.
Many famous musicians have played in this concert hall.

words.definition: An open-air venue used for entertainment, performances, and sports.
sentences: The ancient amphitheater hosted gladiator fights.
The concert was held in an outdoor amphitheater.
The amphitheater can hold thousands of people.

words.definition: A large, open-air venue with tiers of seats for spectators, used for sporting events and concerts.
sentences: The band played to a packed stadium.
The new stadium cost millions to build.
Many big concerts are held in stadiums.

words.definition: A level area surrounded by seating, in which sports, entertainments, and other public events are held.
sentences: The basketball game was held in the arena.
The singer performed in a large arena.
The arena was filled with cheering fans.

words.definition: A room or building for the display or sale of works of art.
sentences: The art gallery showcased local artists.
She bought a painting from the gallery.
Many new galleries are opening in the city.

words.definition: A room or building where an artist, photographer, or musician works or performs.
sentences: The artist works in her studio every day.
The band recorded their new album in the studio.
He has a photography studio.

words.definition: A room or building in which goods are manufactured or repaired, or a meeting at which a group of people engage in intensive discussion and activity on a particular subject or project.
sentences: She attended a pottery workshop.
The artist held a painting workshop.
The workshop taught new creative skills.

words.definition: A public display of works of art or other items.
sentences: The museum is holding a new exhibition of modern art.
The exhibition will run for three months.
We saw an amazing photography exhibition.

words.definition: The language or dialect spoken by the ordinary people in a particular country or region.
sentences: The play was written in the local vernacular.
Vernacular literature often reflects local culture.
He studies the vernacular of the region.

words.definition: A particular form of a language that is peculiar to a specific region or social group.
sentences: She speaks in a regional dialect.
The movie used a specific dialect to make it authentic.
Different parts of the country have different dialects.

words.definition: A distinctive mode of pronunciation of a language, especially one associated with a particular nation, locality, or social class.
sentences: He speaks English with a strong French accent.
Her accent is very charming.
You can tell where he's from by his accent.

words.definition: A type of language that consists of words and phrases that are regarded as very informal, are more common in speech than writing, and are typically restricted to a particular context or group of people.
sentences: Teenagers often use slang words.
That word is considered slang.
He picked up some local slang during his travels.

words.definition: Special words or expressions that are used by a particular profession or group and are difficult for others to understand.
sentences: The legal document was full of jargon.
Try to avoid using too much jargon when explaining things.
Medical jargon can be confusing.

words.definition: The customary code of polite behavior in society or among members of a particular profession or group.
sentences: Table etiquette is important at formal dinners.
Learning proper etiquette is helpful for social situations.
Business etiquette varies in different countries.

words.definition: A habitual gesture or way of speaking or behaving; an idiosyncrasy.
sentences: He has a nervous mannerism of tapping his foot.
The actor adopted a unique mannerism for his character.
Her mannerisms revealed her true feelings.

words.definition: A movement of part of the body, especially a hand or the head, to express an idea or meaning.
sentences: He made a gesture of approval.
Hand gestures are common in communication.
Her gesture showed her frustration.

words.definition: The process of making known one's thoughts or feelings.
sentences: Her face showed an expression of surprise.
Art is a form of expression.
He has a very calm expression.

words.definition: A strong feeling such as joy or sadness.
sentences: The music evoked strong emotions.
She tried to control her emotion.
Art can express deep emotion.

words.definition: A temporary state of mind or feeling.
sentences: The painting created a peaceful mood.
The music set a happy mood for the party.
Her writing often creates a somber mood.

words.definition: The pervading tone or mood of a place, situation, or work of art.
sentences: The restaurant had a cozy atmosphere.
The movie created a spooky atmosphere.
The painting captured the serene atmosphere of the garden.

words.definition: Serving as a symbol.
sentences: The dove is symbolic of peace.
The colors in the flag are symbolic.
The act was highly symbolic.

words.definition: Existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical or concrete existence.
sentences: Love is an abstract concept.
Abstract art does not represent reality directly.
The painting was an abstract representation of emotions.

words.definition: Departing from a literal use of words; metaphorical.
sentences: He used figurative language in his poem.
The painting was figurative, showing human forms.
Figurative speech adds richness to language.

words.definition: Taking words in their usual or most basic sense without metaphor or allegory.
sentences: He took her words literally.
The literal meaning of the phrase is simple.
Don't take everything so literally.

words.definition: The action of explaining the meaning of something; a way of understanding something.
sentences: Everyone had a different interpretation of the painting.
The director's interpretation of the play was unique.
Understanding requires careful interpretation.

words.definition: A particular attitude toward or way of regarding something; a point of view.
sentences: The artist used perspective to create depth in the painting.
Try to see the situation from a different perspective.
Her unique perspective made her art stand out.

words.definition: The way in which parts of a work of art or music are put together.
sentences: The painting has a balanced composition.
The musician worked on the composition of the song.
Good composition makes a photo visually appealing.

words.definition: The visible shape or configuration of something.
sentences: The sculpture had a unique form.
Artists often experiment with different forms.
The building had a modern form.

words.definition: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a surface or a substance.
sentences: The painting had a rough texture.
The fabric had a soft texture.
Artists use texture to add interest to their work.

words.definition: The range of colors used by a particular artist or in a particular painting or piece of art.
sentences: The artist used a warm color palette.
The painting's color palette was very vibrant.
She chose a soothing color palette for her room.

words.definition: A color or shade.
sentences: The painting featured various hues of blue.
The sky changed to a beautiful hue of orange.
She experimented with different hues.

words.definition: A particular type of a color, or the darkness of a color.
sentences: The artist used different shades of green.
The room was painted in a light shade of yellow.
She prefers darker shades for her clothes.

words.definition: A shade or variety of a color.
sentences: The paint had a slight tint of pink.
She added a tint of blue to the mixture.
The sky had a beautiful tint of purple at sunset.

words.definition: The relative lightness or darkness of a color.
sentences: Artists use value to create contrast.
The painting had a wide range of values.
Understanding value is important in drawing.

words.definition: The state of being strikingly different from something else in juxtaposition or close association.
sentences: The painting used strong contrast between light and dark.
The contrast of colors made the image pop.
There was a stark contrast between their opinions.

words.definition: The quality of being made up of exactly similar parts facing each other or around an axis; balanced proportions.
sentences: The building's design showed perfect symmetry.
Symmetry is often found in classical art.
The artist created a symmetrical pattern.

words.definition: Lack of equality or equivalence between parts or aspects of something; lack of symmetry.
sentences: The modern sculpture displayed asymmetry.
Asymmetry can create visual interest.
The design used intentional asymmetry.

words.definition: An even distribution of weight enabling someone or something to remain upright and steady.
sentences: The artist achieved balance in her composition.
Good balance is important in dance.
The painting had a sense of visual balance.

words.definition: A part, share, or number considered in comparative relation to a whole.
sentences: The artist paid attention to the proportions of the body.
The building's proportions were perfect.
Understanding proportion is key in drawing figures.

words.definition: The relative size or extent of something.
sentences: The sculpture was huge in scale.
He drew the map to scale.
The artist worked on a large scale.

words.definition: The art of drawing solid objects on a two-dimensional surface so as to give the right impression of their height, width, depth, and position in relation to each other when viewed from a particular point.
sentences: The artist used perspective to create depth in the painting.
Learning perspective is essential for realistic drawing.
The painting showed a unique perspective.

words.definition: The center of interest or activity.
sentences: The red apple was the focal point of the still life.
The artist used light to draw attention to the focal point.
The statue served as the focal point of the garden.

words.definition: The part of a picture or scene that is furthest from the viewer.
sentences: The artist painted a blurry background.
The mountains were in the background of the photo.
The background complemented the main subject.

words.definition: The part of a view that is nearest to the observer, especially in a picture or photograph.
sentences: The flowers in the foreground were very detailed.
He placed a small figure in the foreground.
The foreground drew the viewer's eye.

words.definition: A public display of works of art or other items.
sentences: The museum is holding a new exhibition of modern art.
The exhibition will run for three months.
We saw an amazing photography exhibition.

words.definition: A keeper or custodian of a museum or other collection.
sentences: The curator organized the new art exhibition.
The museum's curator is an expert in ancient artifacts.
The curator carefully selected the pieces for display.

words.definition: A person who acts as a guide, typically on a voluntary basis, in a museum, art gallery, or zoo.
sentences: The docent gave us a tour of the museum.
Docents share interesting facts about the exhibits.
She volunteers as a docent at the art gallery.

words.definition: A person who gives financial or other support to a person, organization, cause, or activity.
sentences: The wealthy patron supported many artists.
The museum relies on its patrons.
She is a patron of the arts.

words.definition: A person who collects things of a particular type as a hobby or for profit.
sentences: He is a passionate art collector.
The collector owned many rare paintings.
She became a collector of antique dolls.

words.definition: A person responsible for the repair and preservation of works of art, buildings, or other things of environmental or historical interest.
sentences: The conservator restored the old painting.
Conservators work to protect historical artifacts.
She is a conservator specializing in textiles.

words.definition: The action of returning something to a former condition.
sentences: The painting underwent careful restoration.
The restoration of the old building took years.
Art restoration requires great skill.

words.definition: The action of preserving something.
sentences: The organization works for historical preservation.
The preservation of ancient artifacts is important.
They are dedicated to the preservation of natural habitats.

words.definition: A collection of historical documents or records providing information about a place, institution, or group of people.
sentences: The library has a vast archive of old newspapers.
Researchers use archives to study history.
The family kept a detailed archive of letters.

words.definition: A book, document, or piece of music written by hand rather than typed or printed.
sentences: The ancient manuscript was beautifully illustrated.
She found a rare medieval manuscript.
The author submitted her manuscript to the publisher.

words.definition: An object made by a human being, typically an item of cultural or historical interest.
sentences: The museum displayed ancient artifacts.
Archaeologists discovered many artifacts.
Each artifact tells a story.

words.definition: An object surviving from an earlier time, especially one of historical or sentimental interest.
sentences: The old sword was a relic from ancient times.
The museum has many historical relics.
She treasured the relic from her grandmother.

words.definition: The ancient past, especially the period before the Middle Ages.
sentences: The vase dates back to antiquity.
She studies the art of antiquity.
Many great civilizations existed in antiquity.

words.definition: The study of human history and prehistory through the excavation of sites and the analysis of artifacts and other physical remains.
sentences: Archaeology helps us understand past civilizations.
She is studying archaeology at university.
The team made an important discovery in archaeology.

words.definition: The action of digging something out of the ground, or the site of such an action.
sentences: The archaeological excavation revealed an ancient city.
The excavation uncovered many artifacts.
The team worked carefully at the excavation site.

words.definition: An area of ground on which a town, building, or monument is constructed.
sentences: The ancient ruins are an important historical site.
The archaeological site is protected.
They visited a famous historical site.

words.definition: The remains of a building, typically an old one, that has suffered much damage or disintegration.
sentences: We explored the ancient Roman ruins.
The ruins were a testament to a lost civilization.
Many tourists visit the historical ruins.

words.definition: The action of preserving something.
sentences: The organization works for historical preservation.
The preservation of ancient artifacts is important.
They are dedicated to the preservation of natural habitats.

words.definition: The protection of animals, plants, and natural resources.
sentences: Wildlife conservation is vital for the planet.
He works in art conservation.
Conservation efforts help protect endangered species.

words.definition: The action of returning something to a former condition.
sentences: The painting underwent careful restoration.
The restoration of the old building took years.
Art restoration requires great skill.

words.definition: The process by which people from different cultures share ideas, traditions, and ways of life.
sentences: The student program promotes cultural exchange.
Cultural exchange helps foster understanding.
Festivals are great opportunities for cultural exchange.

words.definition: The state of being diverse; variety.
sentences: The city celebrates its cultural diversity.
Diversity in art brings many different perspectives.
Embracing diversity makes society stronger.

words.definition: The practice or policy of providing equal access to opportunities and resources for people who might otherwise be excluded or marginalized.
sentences: The museum promotes inclusion through its programs.
Inclusion ensures everyone feels welcome.
They advocate for greater inclusion in the arts.

words.definition: The fact of being who or what a person or thing is.
sentences: Art can explore themes of identity.
Cultural identity is important to many people.
She found her identity through her art.

words.definition: Something inherited from the past; traditions, achievements, etc., that are passed down from one generation to the next.
sentences: The old building is part of our national heritage.
We should preserve our cultural heritage.
Learning about your heritage is important.

words.definition: Cultural material and tradition transmitted orally from one generation to another.
sentences: Many ancient stories were passed down through oral tradition.
Oral tradition is important for preserving history.
Folktales are often part of an oral tradition.

words.definition: The traditional beliefs, customs, and stories of a community, passed through generations by word of mouth.
sentences: The book collects local folklore.
Many myths and legends are part of folklore.
Folklore often teaches lessons.

words.definition: A traditional story, especially one concerning the early history of a people or explaining a natural or social phenomenon, and typically involving supernatural beings or events.
sentences: The story of Hercules is a Greek myth.
Many cultures have creation myths.
It's a common myth that bats are blind.

words.definition: A traditional story sometimes popularly regarded as historical but unauthenticated.
sentences: The legend of King Arthur is very famous.
Local legends tell of a hidden treasure.
Is that a true story or just a legend?

words.definition: A long poem, typically derived from ancient oral tradition, narrating the deeds and adventures of heroic or legendary figures or the history of a nation.
sentences: The Odyssey is an ancient Greek epic poem.
The movie was an epic tale of adventure.
Epics often feature grand journeys.

words.definition: A long story of heroic achievement, especially a medieval Icelandic or Norse one.
sentences: The Lord of the Rings is an epic saga.
The family saga spanned several generations.
Norse sagas tell tales of Vikings.

words.definition: A short story, typically with animals as characters, conveying a moral.
sentences: The Tortoise and the Hare is a famous fable.
Fables often have a clear moral.
Aesop's Fables are well-known.

words.definition: A simple story used to illustrate a moral or spiritual lesson, as told by Jesus in the Gospels.
sentences: The story of the Good Samaritan is a well-known parable.
Parables often teach important lessons.
He explained the concept using a parable.

words.definition: A short, popular saying, usually of unknown and ancient origin, that expresses some general truth or useful thought.
sentences: An apple a day keeps the doctor away is a common proverb.
Many proverbs offer wisdom.
My grandmother often quoted proverbs.

words.definition: A question or statement intentionally phrased so as to require ingenuity in ascertaining its answer or meaning.
sentences: Can you solve this riddle?
Riddles are fun to try and answer.
The Sphinx posed a famous riddle.

words.definition: A song that originates in traditional popular culture or that is written in such a style.
sentences: She sang a traditional folksong.
Folksongs often tell stories of everyday life.
Many cultures have their own unique folksongs.

words.definition: A rousing or uplifting song identified with a particular group, body, or cause.
sentences: The national anthem was played before the game.
The crowd sang the team's anthem.
This song became an anthem for a generation.

words.definition: A religious song or poem, typically of praise to God or a god.
sentences: They sang a beautiful hymn in church.
Hymns are often sung during religious services.
The choir performed an old hymn.

words.definition: A poem or song narrating a story in short stanzas.
sentences: The singer performed a romantic ballad.
Old ballads often tell tales of love and adventure.
The folk artist sang a traditional ballad.

words.definition: A poem of fourteen lines, typically in iambic pentameter, with any of several rhyme schemes.
sentences: Shakespeare wrote many famous sonnets.
A sonnet usually has 14 lines.
She read a beautiful sonnet.

words.definition: A Japanese poem of seventeen syllables, in three lines of five, seven, and five, traditionally evoking images of the natural world.
sentences: She wrote a haiku about autumn leaves.
Haiku are short and evocative poems.
Writing haiku requires precision.

words.definition: A long, narrative poem that is usually about heroic deeds and events that are significant to the culture or nation.
sentences: Homer's Iliad is a classic epic poem.
Epic poems often feature gods and mythical creatures.
Reading an epic poem can be a long journey.

words.definition: A long written story about imaginary people and events.
sentences: She is reading a new mystery novel.
Writing a novel takes a lot of time.
Many classic novels are still popular today.

words.definition: A story with a fully developed theme but significantly shorter than a novel.
sentences: He enjoys writing short stories.
The collection includes several short stories.
A good short story can leave a lasting impression.

words.definition: An account of someone's life written by someone else.
sentences: I read a biography of a famous scientist.
The biography detailed her entire life.
Writing a biography requires extensive research.

words.definition: An account of a person's life written by that person.
sentences: She wrote her autobiography at the age of 80.
His autobiography revealed many personal details.
An autobiography offers a unique perspective.

words.definition: A historical account or biography written from personal knowledge or special sources.
sentences: Her memoir focused on her years as a journalist.
Memoirs often share personal experiences.
He published a memoir about his travels.

words.definition: A short piece of writing on a particular subject.
sentences: She wrote an essay about climate change.
The teacher assigned a persuasive essay.
His essay was well-researched.

words.definition: A piece of writing in which the words are chosen for their beauty and sound and are arranged in lines which often rhyme.
sentences: He wrote a beautiful poem for his mother.
The poem evoked strong emotions.
Reading a poem aloud can be very powerful.

words.definition: Written or spoken language in its ordinary form, without metrical structure.
sentences: Most novels are written in prose.
His writing style combines poetry and prose.
Prose is the opposite of poetry.

words.definition: Literature in the form of prose, especially novels, that describes imaginary events and people.
sentences: She prefers reading fiction over non-fiction.
The library has a large section of fiction books.
His story was pure fiction.

words.definition: Writing that is based on facts, real events, and real people, such as biography or history.
sentences: He enjoys reading non-fiction books about history.
The documentary was based on a non-fiction book.
Non-fiction provides factual information.

words.definition: A genre of imaginative fiction involving magic and adventure, especially in a setting other than the real world.
sentences: She loves reading fantasy novels about dragons.
The movie is a classic fantasy tale.
Fantasy stories often have magical creatures.

words.definition: A genre of fiction dealing with imaginative concepts such as futuristic science and technology, space travel, time travel, parallel universes, and extraterrestrial life.
sentences: He enjoys watching science fiction movies.
Science fiction often explores what the future might be like.
Many classic science fiction books are still popular.

words.definition: A genre of fiction involving a crime or other event that needs to be solved.
sentences: She loves reading mystery novels.
The movie had a thrilling mystery plot.
The detective solved the mystery.

words.definition: A genre of fiction that is characterized by suspense, excitement, and anticipation.
sentences: The book was a gripping psychological thriller.
Thriller movies keep you on the edge of your seat.
He enjoys reading thrillers before bed.

words.definition: A genre of fiction that aims to frighten, shock, or disgust its audience.
sentences: She doesn't like watching horror movies.
The book was a terrifying horror story.
Horror often explores fears and anxieties.

words.definition: A genre of fiction that focuses on the romantic relationship between two or more characters.
sentences: She enjoys reading historical romance novels.
The movie was a sweet romance.
Romance novels often have happy endings.

words.definition: A literary genre in which the plot takes place in a setting located in the past.
sentences: She loves reading historical fiction about ancient Rome.
Historical fiction often blends facts with imagination.
The book is a great example of historical fiction.

words.definition: An account of someone's life written by someone else.
sentences: I read a biography of a famous scientist.
The biography detailed her entire life.
Writing a biography requires extensive research.

words.definition: An account of a person's life written by that person.
sentences: She wrote her autobiography at the age of 80.
His autobiography revealed many personal details.
An autobiography offers a unique perspective.

words.definition: A historical account or biography written from personal knowledge or special sources.
sentences: Her memoir focused on her years as a journalist.
Memoirs often share personal experiences.
He published a memoir about his travels.

words.definition: The activity or profession of writing for newspapers, magazines, or news websites or preparing news to be broadcast.
sentences: She studies journalism at university.
Journalism plays an important role in society.
He works in investigative journalism.

words.definition: A person who reports news for a newspaper or broadcast.
sentences: The reporter covered the breaking news.
She is a brave war reporter.
The reporter asked many questions.

words.definition: A person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine, or part of one, and who decides what should be included.
sentences: The editor approved the article for publication.
He works as a book editor.
The editor ensures the quality of the content.

words.definition: A person or company that prepares and issues books, journals, or music for sale.
sentences: The publisher released her new novel.
He works for a major book publisher.
The publisher handles printing and distribution.

words.definition: A machine for printing text or pictures from type or plates.
sentences: The invention of the printing press revolutionized communication.
The old printing press is now a museum exhibit.
The printing press made books more accessible.

words.definition: A book, document, or piece of music written by hand rather than typed or printed.
sentences: The ancient manuscript was beautifully illustrated.
She found a rare medieval manuscript.
The author submitted her manuscript to the publisher.

words.definition: Decorative handwriting or handwritten lettering.
sentences: He practices calligraphy every day.
The invitation was written in elegant calligraphy.
Calligraphy is an ancient art form.
